**1: When you think about the environmental impact of software, who comes to
mind as responsible for it? And why did that person or group come to mind?**

Responsible shouldÂ be bothÂ the solutionÂ providersÂ and the regulators.Â 

**2: In your experience, who is currently making decisions about the
environmental impact of software? Is it the right set of people?**

This is difficult as I don't think there's only 1 decision maker. It is the
current system with providers, law makers, regulators that make the most
decisions but these are feeble.Â 



Kind regards,Â 

Maxime.Â

> Hello Maxime,                                                                 
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> Thank you for joining the consensus-building exercise. Your expertise is      
> exactly what we need to answer one of the most critical challenges facing our 
> industry:                                                                     
> #### *Who Should Own Software's Environmental Impact?*                        
> Weâ€™re currently on Day 1of this three-day exercise.                           
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> You've registered early, which means your insights will help shape the        
> foundation consensus statement that hundreds of other practitioners will build
> upon, setting the direction for the entire conversation.                      
> Â                                                                              
> # How This Works                                                              
> **Simply reply to this email with your views**. Write as much or as little as 
> feels right; there are no wrong answers, and what matters is your honest      
> perspectives.                                                                 
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> We'll then share the first consensus statement synthesized from all responses 
> using our AI-supported process. You'll see where agreement stands, where      
> tensions emerge, and what questions the community is raising. Following the   
> statement, we'll send new prompts that build on what we're learning.          
> Â                                                                              
> # Today's Questions                                                           
> **1: When you think about the environmental impact of software, who comes to  
> mind as responsible for it? And why did that person or group come to mind?**  
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> **2: In your experience, who is currently making decisions about the          
> environmental impact of software? Is it the right set of people?**            
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> **3: What barriers have you or your organization encountered when trying to   
> address software's environmental impact?**                                    
> Answer all the questions, a selection or use them as prompts to structure your
> thoughts. The more free-form the response the better.                         
> Â                                                                              
> # Your Voice Matters                                                          
> No matter when you join, your insights will help refine the consensus and     
> surface new agreements or tensions. The final report in January will reflect  
> the full range of perspectives from all participants.                         
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
>                                                                               
> Thank you for being part of this.                                             
>                                                                               
> The Green Software Foundation Team
